title: 113_hr2955
content: The Act may be cited as the "Runaway and Homeless Youth Inclusion Act of 2013". It focuses on the cultural competency of service providers. The Runaway and Homeless Youth Act is amended to include serving youth in a culturally competent manner, and to collect data on sexual orientation and gender identity. The Runaway and Homeless Youth Act is amended to require serving youth in a culturally competent manner for sexual abuse prevention programs. Applicants must certify they have systems in place to ensure culturally competent services for all youth. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL FINDING. Amends the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act to highlight that LGBTQ youth make up a significant portion of the homeless youth population in the United States. SEC. 4. ADDITIONAL PURPOSES. Amends the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act to include family assessment, intervention, and reunification services for sexual and gender minority youth and providing resources for families struggling with understanding or accepting their sexual orientation or gender identity. SEC. 5. REPORT REQUIREMENT. SEC. 5. REPORT REQUIREMENT. Amends the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act to include data on the demographics of individuals, including sexual and gender minority youth, without disclosing their identity. SEC. 6. INCLUSION OF NONDISCRIMINATION STATEMENT. Adds a nondiscrimination statement to the Act. The text prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability in programs funded under this title. The Attorney General and Office of Justice Programs enforce this section. The text prohibits discrimination in programs funded under this title, without diminishing responsibilities under other civil rights laws. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. Section 387 of the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act is amended to include a definition of "culturally competent" as having values and behaviors that enable effective relationships with diverse backgrounds, including sexual and gender minority youth. The amendment to the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act includes defining "culturally competent" as valuing diversity, self-assessment, managing differences, acquiring cultural knowledge, and adapting to diverse communities. Additionally, it defines "gender identity or expression" as an individual's gender-related identity, appearance, or behavior regardless of traditional associations with physiology or assigned sex at birth. The amendment to the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act includes defining "sexual and gender minority youth" as those in a minority category related to sexual orientation or gender identity. It also defines "sexual orientation" as homosexuality, heterosexuality, or bisexuality.
